message: Starting weave discovery between blocks and carmack

data.name: blocks
data.purpose: To enable AI-assisted coding with validating mechanisms that ensure code consistency with domain semantics, preventing runtime issues associated with AI-generated code.
problemsSolved: No shared understanding between AI and domain concepts
Inconsistent output from AI coding tools
Lack of feedback loop for AI corrections
Bugs due to violations of domain rules
data.readmeExcerpt:
# Blocks

**AI-assisted coding with semantic guardrails**

Blocks is a development-time validator that lets AI agents write code freely while maintaining consistency through domain semantics and multi-layer validation. Think of it as a type system for your domain logic‚Äîexcept it uses LLMs to check semantic alignment, not just syntax.

## The Problem

You're using Claude Code, Cursor, or another AI coding tool. The agent generates code fast, but:

- **No shared understanding** - The AI doesn't kn

data.name: carmack
data.purpose: To provide a code editing agent architecture that emphasizes provably correct code transformation while prioritizing traditional programming practices over AI prompting.
problemsSolved: ensuring code correctness
optimizing code transformation speed
automating error resolution
improving code quality
data.readmeExcerpt:
# Carmack Coder ‚ö°

**Philosophy: Traditional Programming > AI Prompting**

candidates.hypothesis: shared_domain: Repos in same domain with complementary roles
matchedArtifacts: carmack produces schemas ‚Üí blocks consumes schemas

data.hypothesis: validator_to_schemas: Validator can check schema-producing repos

data.title: Schema Validation Integration between Blocks and Carmack
data.description: Integrating Blocks with Carmack would allow Carmack's output schemas and types to be validated by Blocks, ensuring semantic consistency and reducing runtime issues in AI-generated code. This integration would emphasize shared understanding across tools that leverage AI in coding environments, enhancing their effectiveness and reliability.
data.specificIntegration: Implement a mechanism where Carmack's generated schemas are sent to Blocks for validation, ensuring they align with domain semantics before they are used in further transformations or tests.
data.valueProposition: This integration would provide robust validation for schemas produced by Carmack, significantly reducing the risk of runtime errors in code generated using AI tools. It promotes a seamless workflow between AI-generated code and traditional programming practices by ensuring that the generated artifacts meet predefined semantic standards.
data.reasoning: The integration addresses a real pain point by allowing the validation of schemas produced by Carmack, leveraging Blocks‚Äô capabilities to ensure consistency. This is actionable as both repositories have complementary functions and are targeting similar domains without existing integration.

data.hypothesis: shared_domain: Repos in same domain with complementary roles

data.title: Integrate Schema Validation in AI-Assisted Coding
data.description: Integrate the schema validation capabilities of Carmack with the AI-assisted coding functionalities of Blocks to enhance code reliability and correctness. By allowing Blocks to leverage the schemas produced by Carmack, we can ensure that AI-generated code adheres to the defined schemas, thus preventing runtime issues and maintaining semantic consistency.
data.specificIntegration: Implement a schema validation layer in Blocks that consumes schemas generated from Carmack, allowing Blocks to validate AI-generated code against these schemas.
data.valueProposition: This integration would provide a robust mechanism for ensuring that AI-generated code not only adheres to syntax but also aligns with the semantic expectations set forth by the schemas. This can significantly reduce bugs and improve the reliability of code generated by AI tools, enhancing overall developer confidence and productivity.
data.reasoning: The integration leverages the complementary strengths of both repositories: Carmack's schema generation and Blocks' validation mechanisms. This collaboration is actionable, provides clear value in terms of improved code reliability, and addresses a real need in the development process of AI-assisted coding. It is not an obvious pairing since both tools focus on different aspects but can work synergistically.

data.philosophyStatement: AI-assisted coding thrives when domain semantics are respected and enforced to prevent inconsistency in generated outputs.
Provably correct code transformation embodies the belief that traditional programming practices offer greater reliability than AI prompting.

matches.description: They fight the same enemy but at different abstraction levels
matches.integrationHypothesis: Both fight inconsistency but at different scales: pattern-level vs architecture-level. Together they form a multi-scale defense.
